1: These are sayings of King Lemuel—an oracle his mother taught him.\q1
2:
She says: You are my son; I carried you in my womb;\q2 you are the son, I made promises to Yahweh for you.
\q1
3:
Do not give your strength to women;\q2 and do not tell what your plans are, to the women who destroy kings.


\q1
4:
Lemuel, kings should be careful about drinking wine;\q2 and a king should never ask, "Where is the strong drink?"
\q1
5:
They could drink but then they might forget that they made a decree of the king,\q2 and tear down the rights of those who have been taken advantage of.

\q1
6: Give strong drink to those who are dying\q2 and to those who are grieving their loss.
7:
One who drinks will forget he is poor,\q2 and he will not remember his trouble.

\q1
8:
Speak for those who cannot speak for themselves,\q2 speak for those who are approaching death.
\q1
9:
Speak out and render judgment according to what is right;\q2 and plead for justice to come in the cases of the poor and the needy.

\q1
10:
Who can find a wife who is good at many things?\q2 Her value is much more than the jewels she could wear.
\q1
11:
Her husband completely trusts her,\q2 and because of her, he will never be poor.
\q1
12:
She does good things for him and not evil,\q2 all the days of her life.


\q1
13:
She finds wool and flax in the market,\q2 and she enjoys spinning it to make yarn and fabric.
\q1
14:
She is like the merchant ships\q2 because she brings her food to her home from far away.
\q1
15:
She gets up before dawn to prepare food for her family,\q2 and she gives each servant girl her duties for the day.

\q1
16:
She goes out and considers what field she will buy, and she buys it.\q1 With the money she has made in other ventures,
\q2 she plants a vineyard.
\q1
17:
She prepares herself with her strength,\q2 and her arms are strong, able to do hard work.

\q1
18:
She knows when she is getting a good profit from her business.\q1 She keeps a lamp burning all night long.
\q1
19:
She holds the spindle,\q2 and then she spins the thread that she will use.


\q1
20: She gives an outstretched hand to help the poor.\q1
21:
She is not worried about the snow,\q2 for everyone in her house have the best winter coats.

\q1
22:
She makes covers for the beds.\q2 She wears fine purple linen clothes—the color of royalty.
\q1
23:
Her husband is well known at the city gates,\q2 and there at the gates he sits with the other leaders of the town.

\q1
24:
She makes linen garments and she sells them.\q2 She sells sashes to shop owners.
\q1
25:
She is strong in her character and respected,\q2 and she laughs at what will happen in the future.


\q1
26:
When she speaks, she says what is wise,\q2 and she lives by the law of kindness.
\q1
27:
She watches over everything that is done in her household,\q2 and nothing in her actions would be anything like laziness.


\q1
28:
Her children speak highly of her;\q2 her husband also praises her.
\q1
29:
He says to her, "There are many women who do admirable things,\q2 but you surpass them all!"


\q1
31: Give her what she has earned,\q2 and her works will praise her among the leaders of the town.
